title.rendered: Understanding cloudification and redefining the gaming industry with cloud gaming- Eric J Dalius explains

content.rendered:
Cloud computing technology has been around for a long time. Remember the Compaq internal stuff in the late 90s? However, in the last 10-15 years, it has gone beyond the ambit of academic discussion and metamorphosed into a real-life, seamless application. The unceasing growth of the internet gives more traction to cloud computing. End-users store their data on Facebook and Gmail, both third-party applications. Businesses can convert their functions into management services like HR Cloud Services or finance. 
  • Cloud has emerged as the foundation for a data-driven business structure and overall society. 
  • The past few years have seen technology becoming a ubiquitous feature in new businesses, with terms like platform-as-a-service (PaaS), Software-as-a-service (SaaS), and Infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS) becoming mainstream.
  • You can measure the cloud’s mercurial rise from the fact that worldwide spending on the platform is set to go from $370.5 billion in 2020 to almost 850 billion by 2025. 
  • Despite the catastrophic impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on every sector, it couldn’t stop the cloud computing juggernaut. 
  • As the world crumbled under the pandemic, the technology transformed into a messiah. 
  • Collaborative and communication tools like Amazon Chime, Google Meet, Zoom, and Microsoft teams helped individuals and businesses connect with one another. 
  • Digital education was a savior and restaurants/eateries turned to prominent food delivery apps for exploring new business turfs like home delivery.

Introducing cloudification

Eric Dalius explains cloudification as enabling and propelling network operators/carriers to innovate enhanced and new services. It’s the art of responding to market demands with the flexibility and scalability of a cloud computing firm. In quintessence, network cloudification defines the process of stretching cloud technologies, platforms, and virtualization resources and capabilities across a communications network. The process makes it more scalable, flexible, and agile. 
  • Take intel as an example. With their expertise and heritage in cloud technologies, the software giant has been the torchbearer of helping operators and businesses in modernizing their respective networks and make grounds for 5G.
  • Operators are currently optimizing various networks for 5G. Cloudification will help them in the quick and smooth delivery of new, innovative services that meet evolving customer needs and expectations. It’ll also help in maximizing revenue.
  • Enterprise can have the leverage of dynamically accessing 5G network tools that they can custom-fit for their business-specific applications, creating new business avenues.
  • Cloudification also helps the consumers and society to connect with one another and work more intelligently. It provides innovation and basically transforms the way you live and work.
  • Virtualization is another crucial aspect here, adds Eric J Dalius. Virtualizing networks makes it a lot easier for upgrading your system to the latest 5G directives. You can also make your functionalities more responsive and match or surpass real-time requirements. This is the clarion call of the gaming industry.
 

Introducing cloud gaming

Cloud gaming means providing games as a core service through cloud computing. You can find experts describing the evolution of virtual reality segment and gliding game that forms a concept proof.  Gaming is another frontier that is encountering its establishments shaking because of the advances made by cloud tech. Cloud-based administrations are behind the ascent of the new plan of action – the membership-based model. Significant businesses are moving to the membership model, and gaming is no exemption — such critical changes occurring guarantee to turn this industry on its head.  Gaming is relied upon to make massive steps to the cloud. The deals of actual duplicates have been falling consistently in the course of recent years and soon actual game duplicates will presumably be surrendered to gatherer’s things simply like vinyl records. In a critical declaration, Sony reported in its 2019 Q1 financials that the deals of its computerized games had outperformed those of the actual duplicates unexpectedly. Computerized duplicates of games are relied upon to keep on surpassing the actual duplicates. The bay will continue developing more conspicuous and this is the place where cloud-based gaming will rake in huge profits In the cloud, you host a cloud gaming platform on cloud servers. There are two principal tools or components in this regard.
  • You engage a game logic in implementing game interactions and game mechanics. You also integrate a video renderer that produces game frames and pathways in real-time. 
  • The Unity gaming fold or engine has realized the virtual gliding game concept. To ensure smooth and consistent playability, and seamless access for scattered and remote players, the makers are offloading the computationally heavy and intensive parts and shifting them to a physically remote platform or cloud server.
  • Many businesses have set three different cloud servers for analyzing the efficiency and efficacy of client-cloud engagement. 
  • It helps in evaluating the cloudification results. You measure computation performance, offloading parameters, the service drop probability, network traffic, and video quality, and perceptual quality. 
 

Changing the gaming industry

Cloud computing breakthroughs are causing countless success stories for new-age firms and startups. From sales forces and CRM solutions to streaming TV shows and movies on Netflix, and listening to Spotify music, you’re looking at a huge business scope here. The several inroads that cloud tech has made are currently shaking the foundations of the gaming industry, which is another zone. Cloud services are influencing the boom of a new business model, which you call the subscription model. 
  • Major industries are incorporating the subscription model. The gaming industry too has joined the bandwagon and is witnessing significant changes. 
  • Cloud subscription models provide tremendous accessibility and ease of use to consumers. 
  • End users are logging into their subscription, taking a game directing from a scintillating game library by directly surfing through the list and streaming it right away.
  • You no longer need to spend hours downloading a game. You need to have the right supportive hardware for this purpose. 
  • Currently, viewers can use their subscription for streaming their games on their TV or any device for that matter. They can do it from anywhere.
  • The growing internet and mobile subscriber base are simply amplifying the rapid growth in the cloud space.
  • With a steady internet connection, you can access cloud gaming and stream it at low latency, regardless of experiencing device or hardware limitations. 
  • It’s a huge breakthrough because an enhanced user experience with minimal latency is critical for widespread and consistent adoption of the technology. 
 

Cloud gaming’s future

It leverages and streamlines real-time video streaming tools and technologies. Cloud gaming underlines the resources for offloading your gaming software’s parts. It includes personal computers, traditional game bars, and consoles, and elastic and powerful cloud bases or infrastructures. Cloud gaming is a boost for gamers, who’re in a perpetual quest for upgrading their PCs or consoles. If you’re a cloud-service provider, you can sell the idling and existing cloud resources that you’ve already deployed to support and promote cutting-edge and resource-hungry games.  Cloud-based membership models offer gigantic convenience and openness to purchasers. Clients can sign in to their membership, get a game straightforwardly by surfing through a library of accessible games and begin streaming the game immediately. Gone are the days, when it used to require hours to download a game, giving that you initially have supporting equipment. Cloud-based models have made it consistent to access and play the games. Subsequently, it’s scarcely astonishing that the cloud has shaken the gaming business profoundly. By 2023, the cloud gaming market is relied upon to outperform $450 million – that is up from $45 million of every 2017, a 900% increment in web-based gaming. For game developers, cloud computing is a big boon. There’s no longer any need to spend months porting your games to various platforms. Resultantly, cloud gaming has got enough traction from both the industry and academicia.
